content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
•  Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0)  
  Consists of a furnace entity used to transform iron ore and coal into iron plates. This structure was employed for additional iron plate production to support subsequent crafting needs.

•  Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0)  
  Consists of a furnace entity used to convert copper ore and coal into copper plates. This facility provided the necessary copper plates to address shortages for downstream recipes.

Note: Multiple attempts were made to deploy a Lab (intended as a research facility for supplying Automation Science Packs) at Position(0.5, 2.5). However, due to missing inventory items and resource shortfalls in the production chain, no Lab structure has been successfully placed on the map.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
•  Incorrect get_entities Usage  
  – When calling get_entities, avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or extra positional parameters.  
  – Always verify the function’s signature to ensure that the number and type of passed parameters match its definition.

•  Lab Placement and Iteration Errors  
  – Before attempting to place a Lab, ensure that the Lab item is available in the inventory.  
  – Validate that API calls returning entity lists yield an iterable (or default to an empty list) instead of None so that subsequent iterations do not fail.

•  Lab Crafting Failures Due to Insufficient Sub-Ingredients  
  – Confirm that all required intermediate ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are sufficiently available before initiating Lab crafting.  
  – Strengthen your resource conversion chain (including smelting and intermediate crafting processes) to meet the recipe requirements, thus avoiding missing ingredient errors during Lab production.
